snippet: Though New York has a stringent facade-inspection law, the girl’s death was a reminder of that law’s limits.
abstract: Two-year-old girl Greta Greene, who was hit in head by falling debris from Manhattan building, dies at hospital; New York City's strict facade-inspection law has increased public safety, but has not eliminated all danger.

byline.original: By MATT A.V. CHABAN and RICK ROJAS

lead_paragraph: Though New York has a stringent facade-inspection law, the girl’s death was a reminder of that law’s limits.

headline.main: Girl, 2, Dies After Being Struck by Falling Piece of Windowsill in Manhattan
headline.print_headline: Girl, 2, Dies After Being Struck by a Falling Piece of Windowsill in Manhattan
